outputs.name: modifier
outputs.description:
A glass modifier that can be assigned to a Honeybee geometry or
Modifier Sets.

inputs.name: _name_
inputs.description:
Text to set the name for the modifier and to be incorporated into
a unique modifier identifier.

inputs.name: _r_trans
inputs.description:
A number between 0 and 1 for the transmittance of the red
channel. (Default: 0).

inputs.name: _g_trans
inputs.description:
A number between 0 and 1 for the transmittance of the green
channel. (Default: 0).

inputs.name: _b_trans
inputs.description:
A number between 0 and 1 for the transmittance of the blue
channel. (Default: 0).

inputs.name: _refract_
inputs.description:
Index of refraction. Typical values are 1.52 for float
glass and 1.4 for ETFE. If None, Radiance will default to using 1.52
for glass (Default: None).

code:
try:  # import the core honeybee dependencies
    from honeybee.typing import clean_rad_string, clean_and_id_rad_string
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import honeybee:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:  # import the honeybee-radiance dependencies
    from honeybee_radiance.modifier.material import Glass
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import honeybee_radiance:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:  # import ladybug_{{cad}} dependencies
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.{{plugin}} import all_required_inputs
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import ladybug_{{cad}}:\n\t{}'.format(e))


if all_required_inputs(ghenv.Component):
    name = clean_and_id_rad_string('GlassMaterial') if _name_ is None else \
        clean_rad_string(_name_)

    # create the modifier
    modifier = Glass.from_transmittance(name, _r_trans, _g_trans, _b_trans, _refract_)
    if _name_ is not None:
        modifier.display_name = _name_
name: HB Glass Modifier 3
description:
Create an glass radiance modifier from a red, green, and blue transmittances
